document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

F2DD916110DA402186E0515E844BEAB2.description:
Identify high school courses that lead to health and medical science industry
certifications.

35503BA030C9401B938F25FBC58E5181.description:
Identify health promotion opportunities to enhance the health and wellness of oneself
and others.

D03F2EBDEF78494D9C7FC55CD151F79F.description:
Identify and create a plan to address a community health-related social issue, such as
organ donation, homelessness, underage drinking, or substance abuse.

598892A87CF8469EB436A38DE6E967A8.description:
Describe strategies to reduce risk to environmental health, and establish goals for
improving environmental health.

067CAAF5E4BA4F84A57BC61CBCD85A23.description: Design crisis-management strategies for natural disasters and emergency situations.

AB62FCC288F549198137791E520EEFD3.description:
Describe and demonstrate methods of avoiding gang-related activity and gang
involvement.

53FE1A829D3F4174870EBFBA04BCA514.description: Practice procedures for peaceful resolution of conflict.

B52F9D1247064F8A98D117084035E4C9.description: Describe methods to avoid violent acts of aggression and use of weapons.

B25589245814400EA54FF379FE09BEFC.description:
Demonstrate effective communication in response to situations influenced by peer
pressure and/or peer approval.

25EC6E3D027C42DF86B82DC7B4667ADD.description:
Describe strategies to set personal boundaries to reduce and prevent relationship and
dating violence.

5E13763EA6104631A962793E9C8FAB71.description:
Advocate for the use of and the additional need for mental health resources at school
and in the community.

1E5A21B0C3A44E66B6601CDB4BD47809.description:
Promote resources and strategies to address unhealthy and abusive peer, family, and
dating relationships.

FADCA6E23A604DB3801D441DF0C65117.description:
Explain how demonstrating empathy, compassion, and acceptance can support others
who are dealing with mental illnesses and challenges and help reduce stigma.

993AB56341844CE29F91530CEA7488F1.description:
Promote safe practices related to online communication and in-person interactions with
individuals one meets online.

74537BC242A840319EA8F4F4DBB23A4F.description:
Encourage responsible teen driving behaviors, and practice using refusal and
negotiation skills to avoid riding in a car with someone who has been using alcohol or
other drugs.

66FC061432AB41B09DC354A8FC373B5B.description:
Educate others about the dangers of electronic cigarettes through a brochure, social
media campaign, or school club.

5DE859C3838A432E927859DED495325F.description:
Demonstrate assertive communication skills to resist pressure to use alcohol, tobacco,
and other drugs.

F78FF0B6D4BB4837BC16E690E755DBCA.description:
Design strategies to address and communicate to others about a selected personal,
community, or global health issue.

2C69BBAA0BF0475C96292E5C4011AF57.description:
Determine strategies for improving access to health care and medical services for
different stages of life.

730ED7EDF0AC4E8293F0882B1D5EEC66.description:
Promote strategies to help individuals select technologies to assess, monitor, improve,
and maintain health.

A31FF3AAC6C44E0FBAA9FF1DEF894AB5.description:
Create or modify a personal wellness plan for physical activity, sleep, personal hygiene,
and other health-enhancing behaviors to prevent communicable and chronic disease.

E0B458F6007C4DA386677FD0A1E07F16.description:
Create or modify a personal wellness plan (i.e., goals and action steps based on current
guidelines) for healthy eating to meet current and future needs.

38CB329986884BFEA07A8D257055B72F.description: Promote strategies for maintaining healthy cardiovascular and lymphatic systems.

A8F1F04A55A145ADAEE7E090D1BCB8CF.description:
The student will advocate for personal health and well-being and promote health-enhancing
behaviors for others.

92B1F9D410004C9EADA8B428C96A6499.description:
Research high school health and medical science industry-recognized credentials (e.g.,
personal trainer, athletic trainer, dietary aide, dental assistant, certified nurse assistant,
home health aide, geriatric aide).

E74E80398E70482FA3B4CAD86671E15B.description:
Analyze how health literacy reduces health risks and enhances health and wellness of
oneself and others throughout life.

65098DBAF1074136AA5B80A0A5176FC5.description:
Describe how and where to access community resources related to organ donation,
homelessness, underage drinking, and/or substance abuse.

876CAD39FB5F4A038CAE608A4B779EEC.description:
Explain the role of health, wellness, education, safety, and business professionals in
addressing environmental health concerns.

11711EC594AF42B4AC12DCEEE68BC9E9.description:
Identify life-threatening situations that may result from emergencies and natural
disasters and community resources for emergency preparedness.

FBADB2FB97E941ED817F5DA7FC88E1F5.description: Evaluate protective factors needed to prevent gang involvement.

922A583A364E46AAB82211BF40A8D92E.description: Identify strategies for the peaceful resolution of conflict.

FAFFE5DEDAF84F54896F0BB986F9F9A7.description: Identify protective factors and strategies that may prevent acts of violence.

5817C06494E643B4AC66EF05FEC69B63.description: Examine the influences of peer approval and peer pressure on decision making.

8FC0060D9AD2467F98D248D861D141C2.description:
Evaluate potentially harmful and abusive relationships, including dangerous dating
situations.

FF22A8103DC149B7BFE7A1321554A358.description:
Identify help-seeking strategies and resources and when to seek support for oneself and
others with signs of mental illnesses or challenges (e.g., depression, suicide ideation).

46DC799C9F6846A2BC755E3693311AE1.description:
Explain the role of respecting the experiences of others; accepting differences; and
establishing, communicating, and respecting boundaries for healthy relationships.

D8E77E724AAB4BD1B652393C414951A6.description:
Describe the stigma surrounding mental illnesses and challenges and the impact of
stigma and discrimination on help-seeking behavior.

E82A85999F174654B9D23B4CA718FD88.description:
Identify what needs to be considered before posting pictures, videos, and
communicating with others online.

D993F1140FAA4FCCB094E8AD541FF44F.description:
Explain the role of the environment, individual behavior, social norms, legislation, and
polices in preventing motor vehicle-related injuries.

0BAB92C21F194BF4984B3F22F79C244B.description:
Evaluate the protective factors needed to reduce or prevent risk-taking behaviors, acts
of violence, and substance use.

F023630542084EBCA7FEA09199BEA1A6.description:
Explain reasons why teenagers use or avoid drugs or alcohol and how positive role
models can influence that decision.

F184ADB63F9748FDBDF5877F05F030FF.description:
Explain the impact of the social determinants of health on a selected personal,
community, or global health issue.

37D2E2920349411B9873691F47351A8B.description:
Explain the purpose of medical screenings, immunizations, vaccines, and tests for
different stages of life and the importance of access to health care throughout life.

6E32B37478FE40B689535C3E92D27FA4.description:
Research the costs and benefits of various technologies that allow individuals to assess,
monitor, improve, and maintain health.

34BA74A92E3E4CB2A67B94EB8C80B62F.description:
Explain the role of the environment, individual behavior, family history, social norms,
legislation, and policies in preventing chronic diseases.

7A66CC3E12904785BDDD2537FBB9B6AC.description:
Compare and contrast diverse diets (e.g., typical American, Mediterranean, vegetarian,
vegan).

5B6723A51F564E3D9966FEA7307EE202.description:
Describe the role of the lymphatic system in providing protection against the spread of
disease and cancer.

A95463B847D94F62A04E1FEA24896E7E.description:
The student will analyze, synthesize, and evaluate the protective factors needed to make
healthy decisions throughout life.

C6471B4E3D4446E9AAD8A9743CEB90C7.description:
Describe attributes, characteristics, and interests of individuals in health-related
professions and the core academic skills needed for workplace skills in a health career.

6258E53CFEB34296A8086C6B37F2AC48.description:
Analyze how health literacy and health-science skills prepare one to become a
productive citizen.

041593D7D30345A1A38021F18D0C95DC.description:
Identify health-related social issues, such as organ donation, homelessness, the spread
of infectious diseases, underage drinking, substance abuse, and violence, and their
impact on the community.

78C8797FFB114052A41D99E7062393B0.description:
Explain how the quality of the environment (e.g., secondhand smoke, carbon
monoxide, allergens, lead, toxic chemicals) directly affects a person’s health status and
quality and length of life.

6EAAE9DC7280447F8C400031BD9DC1A2.description: Investigate natural disasters and emergency situations that affect the community.

7FCE6F56D81542998A8106C7CC5B1F09.description:
Analyze the short- and long-term consequences of gang involvement on personal and
community health now and in the future.

5110EE62678E45FB93DB6C9C7830BA13.description:
Compare and contrast assertive and aggressive communication and how they affect
conflict resolution.

7C192FFAD88249B888D5A8F486C7FE8F.description: Identify the consequences of using acts of violence to settle disputes.

56AB7670B0A0430F9B19DE919A45BB92.description: Identify the skills needed to effectively navigate peer pressure situations.

D02C491A343D4B549A15BFC7F03DAC69.description:
Identify different personal relationships teens are involved in and the characteristics of
each.

E02D5BDCBDCD412E807FBB06415B8424.description:
Identify health professionals and types of services available for mental illnesses and
emotional challenges.

B2AAEFD4EFBB4F4EB10B88C309D83282.description:
Identify characteristics of healthy, unhealthy, and abusive peer, family, and dating
relationships.

240F7FC6CF7D4B7AAC0AB885C727A430.description:
Identify factors that can influence an individual's mental health, including family, social
environment, trauma, genetics, brain chemistry, health behaviors, personal values,
peers, media, technology, culture, and community.

0CADB8DAF296416E991CF48D039D6036.description: List examples and describe the risks of sharing/posting personal information online.

F2F3F647359042A4995DC14DA14BB36D.description:
Identify unsafe behaviors that may result in unintentional injury while riding in or
operating a vehicle.

057FE2F2EB434DCBB21580F39FA3C35A.description:
Evaluate the causal relationship between tobacco, alcohol, inhalant, and other drug use
and chronic disease.

39DBBD7FC6364662A81C6906DC11678D.description:
Research trends and factors that contribute to teen use/abuse and non-substance use of
alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products (e.g., e-cigarettes), opioids, and other drugs and
their impact on the community.

4459A22337AC472BBAE29FAC3A9AC913.description: Identify and research a selected personal, community, or global health issue.

03A742D28E7C4052A69082F9E48587FF.description:
Identify regular screenings, immunizations, vaccines, tests, and other medical
examinations needed for different stages of life and their role in reducing health risks.

7C978CC2856247B38A82836CD6FA2A53.description:
Identify technologies individuals can use to assess, monitor, improve, and maintain
health.

709A54AA9F5548ADA71CACFF4308F7E9.description:
Explain the physical, mental, social, and academic benefits of sufficient sleep and the
relationship between sleep deficiency, chronic disease, and the increased risk for injury
and substance use.

386DD90C5CF347428F3F66D47A5090C0.description: Identify a variety of diets (e.g., typical American, Mediterranean, vegetarian, vegan).

53B0F8174FA246ED89663D6D90BD457E.description: Identify and describe the major structures and functions of the lymphatic system.

F65ABD1D847F405792384100821C6ABE.description:
The student will demonstrate an understanding of health concepts, behaviors, and skills that
reduce health risks and enhance the health and wellness of oneself and of others throughout
life.
